Title: Data Scientist - Internship
Description:
Join us today and make a difference in people's lives!

Join us today and make a difference in people's lives.

We are offering an Internship opportunity to talented candidates in the Data Science area in our Milan office.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data science, artificial intelligence (AI), and machine learning. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to apply statistical techniques, develop machine learning models, and integrate AI-driven solutions into clinical trials and medical strategies.

You will be part of LivaNova, global medical technology company, worldwide leader in cardiovascular and neuromodulation solutions. With almost 3,000 colleagues in more than 100 countries we are facing a steady commercial growth to help creating products and therapies that transform people lives.

Duties And Responsibilities


The program will provide education and hands-on training in data science, dashboarding, data visualization, and advanced analytics in real-world medical device projects and ensuring alignment with healthcare regulations. The trainee will execute cross-functional activities to ignite LivaNova medical excellence.
Assist in developing and enhancing dashboards to support NLP and AI capabilities.
Provide infrastructure support, focusing on the deployment of data-driven projects.
Contribute to R&D initiatives, with a particular focus on physiological control loops.
Collaborate with senior Data Scientists in validation activities.


The Individual


Degree in Biomedical Engineering, Biotechnology, Statistics, Biostatistics, Pharmacy, or any other STEM.
Good knowledge of programming languages like Python or R; SAS would be an advantage.
Fluency in English (mandatory).
A detail-oriented individual with a methodological and accuracy-driven approach.
Willingness to work in a collaborative environment with a global team.


Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

LivaNova values equality and celebrates diversity. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair, transparent and free from unlawful discrimination.

Our selection process is driven by the key demands/requirements for the role rather than bias or discrimination on the basis of a candidate’s sex, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, non-job-related disability/handicap or medical condition, family status, sexual orientation, religion, color, ethnicity, race or any other legally protected classification.

Notice To Third Party Agencies

Please note that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Services Agreement, we will not consider, or agree to, payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event that a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

Beware Of Job Scams

Please beware of potentially fraudulent job postings or suspicious recruiting activity by persons posing as LivaNova recruiters or employees. The scammers may attempt to solicit confidential, personal information, such as a social security number, or your financial information. LivaNova will never ask for fees prior/during/after the application process, nor will we ask for banking details or personal financial information in return for the assurance of employment. If you are concerned that an offer of employment might be a scam or that the recruiter is not legitimate, please verify by searching for “See Open Jobs” on https://www.livanova.com/en-us/careers, and check that all recruitment emails come from an @livanova.com email address.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to build a better future?




About Enfinity Global

Enfinity Global is a purpose-driven company focused on making a positive impact on the planet by helping companies, governments, and individuals transition to a carbon-free and sustainable economy. Our role as a leading IPP is to develop, finance, build, operate, and own renewable energy assets in the long term in Europe, Asia, and the Americas through our offices in the USA, Spain, Italy, UK, Netherlands, India, and Japan.




Our team of over 250 Enfiniters comprises seasoned finance professionals, as well as experienced project developers and operators with extensive industry experience across all stages of the project life cycle. We pride ourselves on being creative and innovative solution providers to our customers and partners.




We’re looking for a Data Scientis to join our Team in Milan.




Main task and duties:




Responsibilities:

· Analyze large datasets from energy production, prices, and consumption to uncover insights and trends

· Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms to optimize energy usage and forecasting (e.g., renewable energy production, demand forecasting)

· Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate key findings to top management

· Assist in building and refining energy price models, optimization strategies, and risk assessment tools

· Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering to prepare data for analysis

· Work closely with market intelligence team to provide actionable insights

· Stay current with trends and innovations in data science and energy markets







Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field

· Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, and data modeling techniques

· Proficiency in Python

· Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI

· Familiarity with SQL for data querying and database management

· Knowledge of energy markets, renewable energy, or sustainability is a plus (but not required)

· Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment

· Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights




In Enfinity Global group you will find a very dynamic and multinational environment in one of the most exciting and impactful industries. Here we will foster your professional and personal growth, and you will have the opportunity to actively contribute and make a real impact on climate change.




Let’s build our future together.







Visit www.enfinity.global to discover more about our culture and values.

Title: Data Scientist Portafoglio Finanziario Junior – Banca Mediolanum
HTML:
Società

Banca Mediolanum Spa

Posizione

Data Scientist - Portafoglio Finanziario

Responsabilità primarie

Banca Mediolanum è un'organizzazione che ridefinisce il panorama finanziario con oltre tre decenni di innovazione. Attraverso le società che ne fanno parte, si dedica a fornire servizi finanziari, bancari e assicurativi su misura che rispondano alle esigenze uniche di ogni cliente. La Banca si impegna a costruire relazioni durature basate sulla fiducia, trasparenza e sull'attenzione ai dettagli. La nostra è una realtà dinamica, fondata su relazioni, responsabilità e libertà. La nostra cultura promuove la positività, la responsabilità e l’innovazione sostenibile. Siamo alla ricerca di talenti che condividano la nostra passione e i nostri valori. Siamo convinti che il successo di un'azienda sia il risultato del successo individuale dei suoi membri. In Gruppo Mediolanum, offriamo più di un lavoro: l'opportunità di contribuire a un cambiamento positivo e di crescere insieme a noi.

Nell’ambito Della Direzione Servizi Di Investimento e Assicurativi, Ed In Particolare Nella Struttura Monitoraggio e Analisi Performance Stiamo Ricercando Una Risorsa Che Si Occuperà Di


  • Supportare il team nelle attività di monitoraggio e analisi delle performance dei prodotti di risparmio gestito oltre all’analisi dei portafogli dei Clienti/Family Banker;
  • Analisi delle caratteristiche dei portafogli dei clienti e dei Family Banker e dei relativi comportamenti finanziari al fine di elaborare strumenti efficaci ed utili a rafforzare le performance di portafoglio;
  • Costruzione di KPI inerenti attività di monitoraggio;
  • Costruzione di modelli statistici anche con l’utilizzo di Machine Learning;
  • Monitoraggio della qualità di dati inseriti nei Database e attività correttive;
  • Monitoraggio, Sviluppo e Analisi Prodotti e Servizi di Risparmio Gestito, in particolar modo sviluppando un senso critico nei confronti degli andamenti dei mercati e della concorrenza;
  • Costruzione di Dashboard aziendali alla fine del monitoraggio delle variabili analizzate.


Profilo competenze

Requisiti


  • Laurea STEM o materie affini con predisposizione all’analisi numerica e quantitativa;
  • Conoscenze dei mercati finanziali e del risparmio gestito;
  • Utilizzo a livello avanzato di strumenti informatici (Excel, PowerPoint, VBA). È ritenuto requisito preferenziale la conoscenza dell’info-provider Bloomberg e/o Morningstar Direct;
  • Conoscenza di PowerBI per la costruzione di Dashboard e Cruscotti Aziendali;
  • Conoscenza di SQL e di Python;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, per interazione quotidiana con società estere del Gruppo;
  • Forte propensione al lavoro di squadra, spirito di iniziativa, flessibilità, orientamento al risultato, lavorare per obiettivi e rispetto delle scadenze.


Sede di lavoro: Basiglio – Milano 3 City - hybrid work

I dati richiesti verranno trattati nell’assoluto rispetto delle disposizioni contenute nel Regolamento Europeo 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR” o “Normativa Privacy”) e sue successive modificazioni ed integrazioni.

E’ possibile visionare l’informativa di Banca Mediolanum SPA, accedendo al seguente link: https://www.bancamediolanum.it/privacy/candidature.

Il Gruppo Mediolanum si impegna a garantire la parità di trattamento a tutti i candidati secondo i principi di Diversity and Inclusion.

Verranno presi in considerazione solo i curricula in linea con i requisiti minimi richiesti.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
I am currently searching for an experience Data Scientist to join a valued client of mine within in the financial sector based in Brussels.




In this role, you will leverage your data science expertise to analyze complex datasets, build predictive models, and uncover insights that drive data-informed decision-making. This freelance opportunity is ideal for a data scientist who values flexibility, thrives on solving real-world problems, and has a passion for innovative analysis.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Build, train, and deploy predictive and machine learning models to address specific business challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and provide data-driven recommendations.
Design and implement experiments to test hypotheses and optimize business processes.
Present findings and communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with advancements in data science and machine learning techniques to continuously improve analyses.




Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist (freelance experience preferred).
Proficiency in data science and machine learning tools, such as Python, R, and SQL.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
Strong skills in statistical analysis, data modeling, and predictive analytics.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and ability to convey complex findings clearly.
Excellent problem-solving skills with strong analytical and critical thinking abilities.




Fluent in English; knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive project-based compensation.
Flexible working arrangements, with remote work options.
Opportunity to work on diverse, impactful projects.
A collaborative environment with a team dedicated to data-driven innovation




If this role sounds like something you would be interested in, Please Apply Now!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


Your Advantages


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G, we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

  • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
  • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
  • Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
  • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
  • Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Agilytic is looking for a passionate and entrepreneurial Data Scientist to turn data into insights, and insights into high-value business decisions for our clients. We hire from all engineering backgrounds.

Our company is based in the south-east vicinity of Brussels, and we work on assignments anywhere in Belgium and neighbouring countries such as Luxemburg, France, the Netherlands and the UK.

As a Data Scientist, you will play a key role in the end-to-end delivery of our projects, from the requirements’ analysis to the automation of the models. This includes data manipulation, data audit, descriptive analysis run, modelling and presentation of the results.

You will be expected to interact with both IT/data specialists as well as business executives (marketing, process, customer care).

The junior data scientist will be coached by a senior data scientist to acquire the business and technical skills to manage his/her projects quickly.

More info here: https://www.agilytic.be/careers

More info here: https://www.agilytic.be/careers

We hire from all engineering backgrounds.

Title: Data Scientist (NL + ENG)
Description:
Founded in 2020 in Belgium, ATS4IT is part of the Moongy Group, established to strengthen agap2IT’s presence in Europe.

Since 2021 we expanded further with the opening of our Danish branch in Copenhagen, and our Spanish brand in Madrid, reinforcing our commitment to being a key player in the European technology landscape.

Proximity, transparency, and collaboration define our approach at ATS. We aim to be your trusted partner and the first choice for your technological challenges

Position: Data Scientist

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Hybrid: 2-3 times a week on the client´s office

Candidates must possess European nationality or a valid work permit for Belgium

Mandatory Languages: One of the national languages (Dutch and French) must be the mother tongue, and the other language must be understood and readable

Job Description:

We are looking for a Data Scientist to develop machine learning models and advanced analytics that solve complex business challenges. The ideal candidate will leverage data to build predictive and prescriptive models.

Responsibilities:


Design and implement machine learning algorithms to solve business problems;
Perform exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling;
Work with large datasets to identify patterns and trends;
Communicate findings through reports and presentations to stakeholders;
Collaborate with engineering and analytics teams to deploy models.



Requirements:


Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field (preferred).
4-6 years of experience in Data Science
Proficiency in programming languages (Python, R, or Scala);
Experience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn);
Strong understanding of statistics and probability;
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure);



What We Offer


DKV Insurance
Free training (technical, behavioral, language) and certifications
Continuous and personalized career progression support
Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies
Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.



At ATS4IT, part of the agap2IT family, we promote equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, based solely on merit.

Join us and be part of the future!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Requisition ID: 2980

Location:

Louvain-la-Neuve, BE

Work regime: Full-Time

Kind of contract: Open Ended Contract

Mission

The Belgian, B-Corp certified company IBA has opened new ways to diagnose and fight cancer and is the global leader in the field of Proton Therapy, next to its activities in radiopharmaceuticals, industrial sterilization and dosimetry.

Challenges we trust you with

The Data team at IBA focuses on using data to add value to the lives of our customers and colleagues. We value agility, ownership, and we are not afraid to challenge the status quo.

Your mission is to help our business teams with extracting insights from data through statistics and artificial intelligence. You'll use your experience to work closely with our data engineers, data scientists and business domain experts to ensure that your projects deliver tangible value and help build IBA a competitive advantage through data. More concretely, you will contribute to applications for predictive maintenance, as well as demonstrate feasibility in ambitious R&D projects.

We are looking for an experienced data professional who can drive a data project end-to-end. This includes deep diving in the business domain, exploring available data, suggesting improvements for data collection, as well as building, deploying, and monitoring AI models and visualizing the results.

How will your first months look like?

First, you’ll get onboarded on our data infrastructure and get a better understanding of the tools we are using. Next, you’ll be introduced on your first data science challenges.

Must-have

What we value


At least 3 years of relevant experience
Solid foundation in all steps of CRISP-DM
Strong foundation in statistics and AI, through education or experience
Proven experience in delivering AI projects
Motivation to understand our business and integrate our domain knowledge
Strong communicator that can describe complex topics in a simple way
Fluent in English, French is a plus
Passionate about data


Nice To Have


Experience with time series and/or natural language projects
Experience with Databricks and Spark
Experience with predictive maintenance
Experience working in an R&D environment


Cherry on the cake

IBA Offers


Competitive salary and benefits, including a company car
Flexible home office policy (3days/week)
Career growth within a globally recognized leader in medical technology
A supportive team environment that values each member's development
A commitment to cutting-edge technology and solving challenging problems
Be part of a BCorp Certified company, balancing professional innovation with personal well-being


Join us at IBA, where you can be part of a dynamic team working on cutting-edge technology in the fight against cancer. Let's make a difference together!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).


Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment


Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.


Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.


Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: ML Engineer - Gen AI
Description:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?

In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.

As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.

Responsibilities

Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository


Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standards.
Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.



Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions


Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus’ context.
Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.



Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence


Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.



Your Profile


Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.



Technical Skills:


Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.



Languages


Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.



Show more

Title: Clinical Data Scientist
Description:
Heads, a global CRO, is seeking a Clinical Data Scientist based in Europe to join its growing global interventional hematology/oncology clinical program in its global Data Management and Statistics department (DMS).




The Clinical Data Scientist is responsible to propose implement and support activities and procedures, as well as, to design and develop automatic processes and statistical tools supporting a clinical study's efficiency monitoring and regulatory compliance.




The Clinical Data Scientist designs and develops SAS codes, macros and templates covering data management and exploration aspects, statistical analysis and interpretation /assessment of results, reporting and monitoring requirements (data and/or reports) on study's evolution, arising from the clinical study's protocol, the statistical plan and the data management plan, as well as, Company processes, regulatory requirements/standards and Sponsors requirements.




This is a full-time position




Main responsibilities:

-Designs and develops statistical tools and processes in SAS to

build SAS datasets from clinical database and other sources (if applicable)
build queries/macros to support data quality issues and data cleaning purposes
generate tables, listings, figures for analysis requirements
implement statistical analysis as specified in the protocol, the Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and the Data Management Plan (DMP)
generate statistical management reports for monitoring the study’s evolution
generate reporting requirements (data and reports) upon study/customer requests
support reporting requirements (data and reports) arising from regulatory agencies
support data transfer requirements for ongoing trials.




-Maintains SAS programs/processes depository and documentation

-Reviews eCRF annotations and data specifications

-Participates in the design of the clinical database for assigned clinical studies

-Prepares the statistical analysis, as well as clinical, statistical summary reports or/and customer reports

-Performs data transfer and reporting requirements for assigned studies

-Validates the programmed analysis datasets, macros, queries and analysis results (listings, tables, figures) prepared by other members of the Data Management and Statistics Department

-Provides support to other members of the Data Management and Statistics Department both in the use of Company’s statistical tools and processes

-Assists other members of the Data Management and Statistics Department in developing SAS programs/macros for generating tables, listings, figures and analysis datasets

-Provides support on processes to other Departments’ staff or external partners for the assigned studies and/or to Sponsors

-Reviews and updates departmental SOPs

-Oversees systems UAT

-Approves and conducts departmental trainings




Required qualifications:

− BSc in Statistics, Mathematics, Biostatistics, Data Analysis, Data Science, or

related field

− MSc in Statistics, Mathematics, Biostatistics, Data Analysis, Data Science, or

related field

-At least 5 years of experience in a SAS environment preferably in clinical

studies in a CRO, pharma or equivalent institution

− Excellent command of spoken and written English

-Experience in the design and development of statistical tools for automatic/monitoring

processes

− Experience in reporting platforms and procedures/ standards for regulatory purposes

− Proficient in statistical computing or statistical programming language

− Expertise in data management, statistical analysis processes and reporting in SAS

software

− Excellent analytical skills

− Ability to identify data quality issues, present problems, design and implement solutions

− Capability of communicating technical concepts clearly, concisely, and understandably to non-statistical colleagues

− Strong communication skills

− Ability to work in a collaborative environment

− Strong organizational, problem-solving, and decision-making skills

− Organizational and time management skills with the ability to multi-task




Join us to be part of a multidisciplinary team of highly skilled scientists and healthcare professionals in the forefront of Clinical Research within a friendly work environment.

Competitive remuneration package comes on top.




In Heads we consider Data Protection an integral part of our operational business principles and are committed to respecting your privacy. For information on how we process your personal data please visit our Privacy Notice to Candidates: https://heads-research.com/canditates-privacy-notice/

Show more

-Participates in the design of the clinical database for assigned clinical studies

-Prepares the statistical analysis, as well as clinical, statistical summary reports or/and customer reports

-Performs data transfer and reporting requirements for assigned studies

-Validates the programmed analysis datasets, macros, queries and analysis results (listings, tables, figures) prepared by other members of the Data Management and Statistics Department

-Provides support to other members of the Data Management and Statistics Department both in the use of Company’s statistical tools and processes

-Assists other members of the Data Management and Statistics Department in developing SAS programs/macros for generating tables, listings, figures and analysis datasets

-Provides support on processes to other Departments’ staff or external partners for the assigned studies and/or to Sponsors

-Reviews and updates departmental SOPs

-Oversees systems UAT

-Approves and conducts departmental trainings


Required qualifications:

− BSc in Statistics, Mathematics, Biostatistics, Data Analysis, Data Science, or

related field

− MSc in Statistics, Mathematics, Biostatistics, Data Analysis, Data Science, or

related field

-At least 5 years of experience in a SAS environment preferably in clinical

studies in a CRO, pharma or equivalent institution

− Excellent command of spoken and written English

-Experience in the design and development of statistical tools for automatic/monitoring

processes

− Experience in reporting platforms and procedures/ standards for regulatory purposes

− Proficient in statistical computing or statistical programming language

− Expertise in data management, statistical analysis processes and reporting in SAS

software

− Excellent analytical skills

− Ability to identify data quality issues, present problems, design and implement solutions

− Capability of communicating technical concepts clearly, concisely, and understandably to non-statistical colleagues

− Strong communication skills

− Ability to work in a collaborative environment

− Strong organizational, problem-solving, and decision-making skills

− Organizational and time management skills with the ability to multi-task


Join us to be part of a multidisciplinary team of highly skilled scientists and healthcare professionals in the forefront of Clinical Research within a friendly work environment.

Competitive remuneration package comes on top.


In Heads we consider Data Protection an integral part of our operational business principles and are committed to respecting your privacy. For information on how we process your personal data please visit our Privacy Notice to Candidates: https://heads-research.com/canditates-privacy-notice/

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Als ervaren data scientist puur je relevante inzichten uit de grote hoeveelheid data waarover Colruyt Group beschikt. Je maakt statistische modellen voor onze verschillende retailmerken. Het resultaat van jouw werk: een nog betere dienstverlening op maat van onze klanten.




Wat doe je concreet?




In de divisie Data & Analytics werk je in multidisciplinair team bestaand uit data science engineers, bi engineers, business analysts, … Samen bieden jullie analytische oplossingen aan voor de verschillende Colruyt Group merken, zoals Colruyt, Okay, Bike-Republic of Jims. In het data science kennisgroep worden ervaringen en kennis uitgewisseld. Op deze manier blijf je bijleren.
Als data scientist werk je samen met complementaire collega’s aan een brede waaier van projecten waarbij je in aanraking komt met nieuwe technieken en technologieën. We moedigen je ook aan om zelf, in overleg met het team, op zoek te gaan naar nieuwe methoden en technieken en zo de kennis en skills van de groep te vergroten. Naast een heel ruim aanbod aan interne opleidingen krijg je ook de kans om aanvullende opleidingstrajecten te volgen. Op die manier bouw je continu aan je business-kennis, je technische skills en je sociale vaardigheden.
Met het team focussen we enerzijds op onze interne klanten, de business-partners. We vertalen hun vragen in analytische projecten die we aanpakken in multidisciplinaire teams. Dat resulteert in een directe en nauwe samenwerking met ETL, software development en de businesspartner.
Anderzijds zijn we ook verantwoordelijk voor de identificatie van nieuwe analytics-opportuniteiten. We gaan proactief op zoek naar nieuwe inzichten die een toegevoegde waarde creëren voor onze partners. Daarbij kijken we uiteraard niet alleen naar Colruyt Group, maar volgen we ook de externe trends op het vlak van use cases rond analytics en technologische innovatie.
Colruyt Group bestaat uit veel verschillende entiteiten. Dat zorgt voor een enorme variatie en hoeveelheid aan data én use cases. De projecten waar je aan meewerkt gaan dan ook van klantensegmentatie over verkoopsprognose en analyse van winkeltesten tot operationele efficiëntie van machines, predictive maintenance en optimaal gebruik van grondstoffen.




Je werkt in Halle en kan tot drie dagen per week thuiswerken.




Profiel




Opleiding en ervaring – Je hebt een solide basis in handels- en of computerwetenschappen, statistiek, wiskunde of ingenieursstudies. Je hebt minstens 3 tot 5 jaar relevante ervaring.
ennis statistische modellering – Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van statistische modellering en kan deze implementeren in Python. Je hebt kennis van SQL en datavisualisatie-technieken.
Analytisch vermogen – Je slaagt erin om data te vertalen naar inzichten en je kan die ook helder en duidelijk communiceren.
Talenkennis – Kennis van het Nederlands is een must. Je praat zeer vlot Engels. Kennis van het Frans is een plus.




Wij bieden




Stimulerende werkomgeving – Je belandt in een ongelooflijk boeiende en rijke data-omgeving, krijgt ruimte voor initiatief en krijgt een brede kijk op het bedrijf.
Permanente leermogelijkheden – Je leert dagelijks bij en krijgt ook de kans om jouw talenten te ontwikkelen via interne en externe opleidingen. Op termijn zijn er ook reële doorgroeikansen.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een competitief loon met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, winstdeelname en maaltijdcheques.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken

Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)

Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?

Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt ervaring als tech lead in een nieuwe start-up omgeving.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig tewerk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?

Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Title: Applied ML Engineer
Description:
Join an AI-powered platform transforming how creators, filmmakers, and animators craft videos with precise control.




Position: Applied ML Engineer

Location: Remote

Salary: upto €130,000




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain ML pipelines aligned with our product roadmap.
Deploy and optimize GenAI models like Stable Diffusion and GANs.
Collaborate with design and engineering teams to solve unique challenges.
Build scalable, cost-effective APIs for cloud-based models.




Requirements:

Experience with large-scale ML systems and Python/PyTorch.
Expertise in computer vision, machine learning, and AI.
Bachelor’s in Computer Science or equivalent experience.




Take the next step towards an exciting career by clicking the "Apply" button. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Scientist / AI Engineer
Description:
Job Description




My client are at the forefront of technology, specializing in AI-driven solutions within a rapidly evolving industry. Their mission is to push the boundaries of what's possible with AI, especially in sectors where precision and quality are paramount. We are looking for a visionary leader to join their team and drive cutting-edge projects that will shape the future.




They building a next-generation data platform, powered by Databricks on Azure, to support all our data initiatives. The goal is to transition toward a data mesh architecture that offers scalability, flexibility, and seamless access across teams. We believe that fostering collaboration and innovation creates a data-driven culture that empowers everyone to make informed decisions.




What You'll Do

Design and manage our data infrastructure on Databricks and Azure to ensure it is scalable and high-performing.
Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders to create a platform that aligns with various team needs.
Contribute to platform architecture using data mesh principles to enable decentralized data ownership.
Ensure the platform meets security and performance standards, and implement innovative best practices.
Collaborate with other teams to support end-to-end data integration and workflows for multiple data products.
Stay updated on the latest advancements in data platform technology and engineering.

Your Background

3-5 years of experience in data engineering, ideally within a data and analytics setting.
A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a similar field.
Strong expertise in Azure and Databricks, including infrastructure as code, data lake storage, and ETL processes.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a passion for innovation.
Familiarity with data mesh concepts and experience working within decentralized data architectures.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with a drive to work with cross-functional teams.

What We Offer

We’re committed to creating a supportive, inclusive environment that values personal growth and work-life balance. Here’s what we offer:

An international, diverse workspace with professionals from various fields.
A culture that emphasizes respect, collaboration, and continuous learning.
An extensive onboarding program, with mentorship to help you grow.
Competitive salary, comprehensive health coverage, paid leave, retirement benefits, and flexible work arrangements.

Show more

Title: ML Engineer - Gen AI
Description:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?




In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.




As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.




Responsibilities:




Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository.

Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standadrs.
Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.

Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions.

Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus’ context.
Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.

Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence.

Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.




Your Profile:

Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Technical Skills:

Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.
Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.
Show more

  • Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
  • Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
  • Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.
  • Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
AI Data Scientist AI/ML (Previous pharmaceuticals experience)

Fully remote - Europe based

1 Year contract




We are seeking an experienced AI Data Scientist with a strong background in deep learning and a passion for hands-on coding and modelling. In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy models that solve complex business challenges.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy deep learning models to tackle business problems.
Perform hands-on coding in Python, R, or similar programming languages to build scalable AI solutions.
Research and implement the latest advancements in AI and deep learning techniques.
Collaborate with data engineers and product teams to integrate models into production systems.
Continuously optimise and refine models for performance, scalability, and accuracy.
Communicate results and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.




Requirements:

4-5 years of experience in data science, with a focus on deep learning and AI.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or other deep learning frameworks.
Strong understanding of neural networks, CNNs, RNNs, and other deep learning architectures.
Experience with large datasets and deep learning model training at scale.
Incredibly hands-on in coding, data wrangling, and model development.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering practical AI solutions.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) for AI model deployment is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you ready to learn fast and have a real impact in your job?




Join Odoo, a growing software company with an open source product,

a huge global community, as well as a fun and exciting work environment.




We are now looking for a Data Scientist to join our FP&A team. This person will play a strategic role in making the most of transactional data. Our Data Scientist will improve efficiency, anticipate risks, and make informed decisions to optimize commercial and financial operations.




We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our Finance department. As a Data Scientist, you will play a central role in analysing large datasets, identifying patterns, and developing predictive models to enhance our FP&A department.

You will analyse transaction data, such as purchases, payments or transfers, to detect trends and patterns. Another key role is to optimise transaction processes to improve efficiency. For example, by analysing processing times, bottlenecks or transaction failure rates, you will suggest adjustments to smooth operations and reduce costs.

You'll build cash flow or revenue forecasting models based on historical transaction trends. These forecasts will help Odoo to better manage their budget and anticipate their cash flow needs. You'll monitor transaction performance, in terms of success rate, turnaround time, and customer satisfaction. Thanks to these analyses, Odoo will be able to adjust its strategies to improve the overall performance of its transactional services.

Your work will directly impact our ability to deliver secure, efficient, and optimized analysis within our company.




Programming Languages: Python
Database: SQL
Machine learning models: regression, classification, clustering
Framework: Odoo (ORM, Workflows, Report Engine, BI, AI)







Responsibilities:

Create complex and custom data models in Odoo, often working with financial, accounting, and other enterprise data. Compile, normalize, and analyse disparate datasets to help solve problems.
Help improve efficiency in processing large quantities of data by automating repeatable processes
Perform advanced querying techniques in SQL (and other database languages) to profile, summarize, make sense of, and trace information across systems
Assist with drafting reports, presentations, and other deliverables to create dashboards in Odoo to present analytics-driven insights to internal teams
Communicate effectively to all levels of engagement management and externally







Must Have

Master Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
1+ year of experience in data science, with a focus on the transaction services
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or SQL
Good Communication
Attention to Detail
Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and contribute to the success of cross-functional projects
Excellent command of English







Nice to have

Experience in the financial services or transaction services industry
Demonstrated experience in programming or contributing to large codebases
Knowledge of statistical methods, data mining, and predictive analytics
Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance standards in the transaction services industry
Knowledge of transaction processing systems, or financial services is highly desirable

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.




For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.




You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Science solutions
Going into production with Data Engineers
Creation of POC, model development
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?

You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French
Show more

Title: NLP Engineer
Description:
Job Title: NLP Engineer




Location: Fully Remote (EU)




Salary: €80,000 + Stock Options




About the Company:




Our client, an innovative leader in the AI chatbot space, is seeking an experienced NLP Engineer to join their growing team. They are at the forefront of conversational AI, developing cutting-edge natural language processing (NLP) technologies that enhance user interactions and streamline business operations. This fully remote role offers flexibility to work from anywhere within the EU, with a competitive salary and stock options as part of the package.




Position Overview:




As an NLP Engineer, you’ll play a pivotal role in advancing our client’s AI chatbot capabilities by designing, building, and refining NLP models. You will collaborate with a passionate team of AI experts to improve the chatbot’s understanding and response to natural language, pushing the boundaries of AI-powered conversations. This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced NLP professional looking to work in a fast-growing, tech-forward company that values innovation and excellence.




Key Responsibilities:




Develop and deploy state-of-the-art NLP models for tasks such as text classification, sentiment analysis, and entity recognition.
Improve and optimize the existing NLP frameworks to enhance performance, accuracy, and scalability.
Work closely with data scientists and AI engineers to integrate NLP models into production systems.
Conduct research to stay abreast of the latest trends and innovations in NLP and apply these insights to the development process.
Optimize chatbot algorithms to handle large-scale data and real-time user interactions.
Debug, troubleshoot, and continuously improve NLP models to meet performance benchmarks.




Ideal Candidate:




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in NLP, with hands-on expertise in libraries such as Hugging Face, spaCy, or TensorFlow.
In-depth knowledge of machine learning models, transformers, and language models (e.g., GPT, BERT).
Proven experience deploying NLP models in production environments.
Proficiency in Python (additional languages like Java or C++ are a bonus).
A strong passion for NLP, AI, and solving complex problems.




What’s on Offer:




A competitive salary of €80,000 + stock options.
Fully remote work across the EU with flexible working hours.
The opportunity to join a pioneering AI company at a time of rapid growth.
Stock options allowing you to share in the company’s long-term success.
An innovative and collaborative culture focused on cutting-edge AI technologies.




How to Apply: If you're an experienced NLP Engineer ready to take your career to the next level with a dynamic, AI-focused company, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Growth Data Scientist
Description:
About the Opportunity ✍️

We're on the lookout for a skilled Growth Data Scientist to join our team, where you'll be pivotal in driving business growth and maximising ROI. This is your chance to make a significant impact on our market-leading products, optimising growth initiatives and delivering actionable insights. Join us and be part of an exciting journey to reshape our industry!




What you will do

Provide analytical support to the growth marketing team across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Maintain and improve our marketing tracking and attribution systems.
Oversee and implement A/B tests and other experiments to drive forward optimization efforts.
Automate attribution and CRM campaign reporting.
Measure and optimise ROI of campaigns.
Leverage and incorporate forecasting or predictive modelling techniques to drive recommendations / actionable insights.
Develop data-driven strategies for acquisition, retention, and expansion.
Build robust data models downstream of backend services and external data sources.
Design, build and scale both internal and external data products, which drive informed decision making; examples include dashboards, reports, models, algorithms, integrations into other product lines.
Communicate complex concepts and findings effectively to technical and non-technical audiences across different teams, including VPs, while ensuring clarity and understanding to drive critical business decisions.




About You

As a Growth Data Scientist you will be expected to be able to independently lead projects from end-to-end, as well as mentor and coach other data analysts on the team. You will be someone who can contribute to our overall approach and standards within the data discipline. You will be proactive in spearheading initiatives to support stakeholders and business partners around the organisation.




What you will need

Experience with mobile measurement platforms and web tracking tools (e.g. Braze, Appsflyer, Adjust, GA360/GA4, Mixpanel, Amplitude, Segment).
Experience working in ROAS performance marketing framework with familiarity with AdTech and incrementality measurement approaches.
Experience with web analytics, web tracking and app tracking.
Advanced SQL, data modelling, and data visualisation tools are second nature to you.
You have a deep understanding of the fundamentals of statistics and probability, including experience in conducting large-scale A/B tests.
You have experience working with growth or product teams on acquisition, retention and campaign optimisations.
You have the versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job and adapt quickly to changing priorities within a very dynamic environment..
You are experienced in communicating with cross-functional stakeholders including product managers, engineers, VP & C-level executives.
3-5+ years experience as a growth analyst.




Bonus points if

You have experience working in fintech
You have experience working in start-ups or scale-ups
You have knowledge of cryptocurrency
You have worked with DBT, Google BigQuery, Looker and Python

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Location(s):


Avenue Louise 250, 1050, Brussels, BE


Line Of Business: Data Solutions OU(DAAS OU)

Job Category:


Engineering & Technology


Experience Level: Experienced Hire

At Moody's, we unite the brightest minds to turn today’s risks into tomorrow’s opportunities. We do this by striving to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome to be who they are-with the freedom to exchange ideas, think innovatively, and listen to each other and customers in meaningful ways.

If you are excited about this opportunity but do not meet every single requirement, please apply! You still may be a great fit for this role or other open roles. We are seeking candidates who model our values: invest in every relationship, lead with curiosity, champion diverse perspectives, turn inputs into actions, and uphold trust through integrity.

About The Role

We're looking for a Data Scientist with a strong focus on prompt architecture and engineering to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge solutions leveraging large language models (LLMs) and other AI technologies. You will play a critical role in designing, implementing, and optimizing prompt engineering strategies to enhance the performance and efficiency of our AI systems.

Location: Brussels

Key Responsibilities:


Design innovative solutions to solve real business problems, working with teams to understand their needs and identify automation opportunities.
Design, develop, and test prompts for various LLMs and generative AI models, focusing on achieving specific outcomes and maximizing model performance.
Develop and maintain a prompt library and framework for consistent and scalable prompt engineering across different projects.
Conduct rigorous experiments to evaluate LLMs and prompt effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and iterate on prompt design.
Explore and implement advanced prompt engineering techniques, including few-shot learning, chain-of-thought prompting, and retrieval augmented generation.
Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and product managers to integrate optimized prompts into production systems.
Analyze and interpret model outputs to identify potential biases, limitations, and areas for further refinement.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, LLMs, and prompt engineering research and development.
Contribute to the development of best practices and guidelines for prompt engineering within the organization.
Document and share your findings, insights, and best practices with the team.


Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
At least 2 years of experience in a similar role, focusing on AI prompt engineering and architecture.
Strong understanding of NLP concepts and techniques, with experience working with LLMs and generative AI systems such as OpenAI GPT, Anthropic Claude, and Gemini.
Proven experience in prompt engineering, including prompt design, optimization, and evaluation.
Deep understanding of key prompt engineering concepts like zero-shot, few-shot, chain-of-thought, and constraint setting.
Solid understanding of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques.
Experience with data analysis and manipulation tools.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
Superior communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.


Preferred Qualifications:


Eagerness to learn new technologies and adapt to industry trends and changes.
Familiarity with Agentic AI concepts.
Familiarity with different LLM APIs and deployment strategies.
Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP).
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).


Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Wat houdt deze vacature in?

“Data is the new electricity” stelt onze CEO, het brengt een heuse revolutie teweeg. KBC wil binnen de financiële sector dé referentie zijn op het vlak van data analytics en AI. We willen een datagedreven organisatie zijn. Als lid van het data science team zit je aan de kern van onze strategie.

Samen ontwikkelen we AI- en ML-oplossingen die onze business transformeren. We werken daarvoor onder meer met data science platformen als HDFS, Spark en AWS.

Versterk jij dit team, dan kan je ervan op aan dat je impact zal maken. We zullen data op een betere manier gebruiken, onze klanten beter begrijpen en onze processen en risico’s beter beheren. Is dat iets waar jij mee je schouders onder wil zetten?

Wat verwachten we van jou?


Je ontwikkelt AI-/ML-oplossingen die onze business transformeren. Om die uit te rollen en te onderhouden werk je nauw samen met je collega’s bij IT.
Je blijft up to date over data science en AI.
Je zorgt mee voor een sterkere basis binnen KBC Groep op het vlak van kennis en technologie.
Je netwerkt met mogelijke academische en commerciële partners om partnerships op te zetten.
Je leidt E2E data science projecten, inclusief stakeholder management en communicatie en het ondersteunen van junior data scientists;


Jouw troeven?


Je hebt een masteropleiding met minstens 2 jaar ervaring in data scienceof je hebt een doctoraatin econometrie, actuariële wetenschappen, wiskunde, toegepaste wetenschappen, computerwetenschappen, statistiek, fysica of een vergelijkbare discipline.
Je communiceert vlot in het Engels. Zo lukt het je bijvoorbeeld om een AI-oplossing helder uiteen te zetten naar het management toe. Kennis van het Nederlands of het Frans is een pluspunt.
Je hebt ervaring met data analytics en gaat vlot om met de gangbare tools voor statistische analyse en machine learning en (generatieve) AI.
Dankzij jouw inzicht in learning algorithms, strategieën om data te verwerken, machine learning en natural language processing weet je hoe je deze kan implementeren in een business context.
Je bent sterk met Python en data science toolsets (pandas, scikit-learn of H2O, Hugging Face etc). Heb je ook enige ervaring met één of meerdere van deze zaken, dan is dat een meerwaarde:
learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch of Keras)
big data analyses via cloud computing (AWS of MS Azure)
Apache Spark, Hadoop, Kubernetes
Cloudera
Git
Heb je al ervaring met data science in een business context, dan spitsen we helemaal onze oren. Maar ook als je die ervaring niet hebt leren we je graag kennen. Vooral je motivatie vinden we belangrijk.


Wat hebben we je te bieden?


Je werkt samen met een uitzonderlijk team data science professionals: mensen met verschillende culturele achtergronden, die zowel in het onderwijs als in hun professionele loopbaan verschillende paden bewandeld hebben. Die diversiteit verrijkt ons team.
Onze digitale assistente Kate en beleggingsassistent Matti zijn bekenden bij onze klanten. Jij helpt deze virtuele assitenten om mee te groeien met onze ambities. Je werkt met andere woorden aan impactvolle, strategische projecten.
Naast on-the-job learning investeren we in jou met een uitzonderlijk aanbod opleidings- en ontwikkelingskansen. Je wordt aangemoedigd om te blijven groeien als persoon en professioneel. Er zijn concrete pistes om door te groeien binnen KBC.
Je krijgt een contract van onbepaalde duur en een competitief loon. Je kan ook kiezen uit een waaier aan extralegale voordelen.
Onze werkplekken zijn vlot bereikbaar met het openbaar vervoer. Ook los van de coronamaatregelen kan je deels thuiswerken, als je dat wil.
Dankzij flexibele werkuren kan je je werk en je privéleven op elkaar afstemmen.


Klinkt dit als de perfecte match voor jou? Aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren en jouw motivatiebrief in het Engels te schrijven.
Show more
