Title: AI engineer
Description:
Als AI engineer bij ICTS werk je samen met IT-professionals om uitdagende AI-opportuniteiten te verkennen, oplossingen te ontwerpen en de benodigde tools beschikbaar te stellen, zowel in de cloud als on-premise, met als doel onze organisatie op dit vlak naar een hoger niveau te tillen.

En dit voor de meer dan 100.000 studenten en 15.000 medewerkers van de Associatie KU Leuven!

Zo help jij hen op jouw manier de wereld weer wat beter maken. Impact? Check!

Functie

De beste AI-oplossingen realiseer je niet zomaar. Daar komt heel wat bij kijken, o.a. dit:


Technologie met een grote T: GPT, DALL-E, MS co-pilot, github copilot, Claude, Gemini, Llama, TensorFlow, Dialogflow, …
Samen met je IT-collega's ontwerp je een (gen)AI-architectuur die de basis vormt voor AI-oplossingen. Dit doe je door generieke AI-services in de cloud te combineren met on-premise infrastructuur.
Je analyseert AI-use cases samen met de business en maakt een weloverwogen afweging of de inzet van AI een substantiële meerwaarde biedt.
Je ontwerpt AI oplossingen samen met alle belanghebbenden, waaronder de business eigenaar, de eindgebruiker en de IT-specialisten, om een breed draagvlak te creëren.
Je speelt een cruciale rol in het ontwikkelen van AI-oplossingen voor KU Leuven, via een agile en incrementele aanpak zorg je voor een realistische en soepele implementatie van features en initiatieven.
Je bewaakt dat de AI-oplossingen voldoen aan ethische richtlijnen (AI Act) en houdt rekening met kwesties zoals bias, eerlijkheid en transparantie.
Je bouwt je kennis verder uit, volgt de evoluties in (gen)AI op en kent de verschillende AI-implementaties, inclusief hun mogelijkheden en beperkingen. Deze kennis gebruik je om de KU Leuven AI architectuur aan te vullen en bij te sturen.


Profiel


Je hebt een masterdiploma in informatica of in een richting waar informatica belangrijk is. Of je hebt via bijkomende opleidingen en opgedane ervaring een brede informaticakennis opgebouwd.
Je hebt bij voorkeur 5 jaar professionele ervaring in een ICT-job en beschikt over een brede en diepgaande kennis van AI-technologieën, machine learning en data-analyse .
Als agile-adept weet je dat teamwork, samenwerken over teams heen, creativiteit en enthousiasme de sleutels tot succes zijn.
Je kan effectief communiceren en bent in staat samen te werken met verschillende stakeholders.
Je beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden om gegevens te interpreteren, trends te identificeren en beslissingen te nemen op basis van data.
Je bent in staat om complexe problemen te identificeren, IT-architecturen te ontwerpen en oplossingsvoorstellen uit te werken.
Je bent een creatief denker en ontwikkelt innovatieve ideeën.
Je kan kosten en baten afwegen en zorgt zo voor een duurzame en ethische inzet van AI.
Onze voertaal is Nederlands. Basiskennis van het Engels is daarnaast een must.


Aanbod

Een job met impact en complexe uitdagingen. Waar je kennis blijft verdiepen, verbreden of allebei. Waar je een goede balans tussen werk en privé kan combineren met een waaier aan groeimogelijkheden. En waar je gewoon kan zijn wie je bent.

Daarbij Hoort Natuurlijk Ook Nog Dit


Een mooi verloond voltijds contract van onbepaalde duur. Tewerkstelling van 80% is bespreekbaar.
Extra’s als hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, ecocheques, fietsvergoeding, thuiswerkvergoeding, …
Collega’s en techies om mee te sparren en van te leren binnen een uitdagende maar warme omgeving.
Een topsfeer die we met plezier voeden tijdens heel wat fun-momenten tijdens en buiten het werk.


ICTS is het Silicon Valley van KU Leuven, zonder de tech-reuzen. ICTS is een echte technologie-hub waar 300 gepassioneerden voor kwaliteit, verwondering en innovatie zorgen. Dit alles in een agile speeltuin waar we de lat zo hoog mogelijk maar de drempels laag houden. Ontdek meer over werken bij ICTS: https://www.kuleuven.be/icts/jobs (klik op de link bij 'Meer informatie').

Tot Slot, Onze Barema’s


Ben je onmiddellijk inzetbaar in alle opdrachten van deze job, heb je de nodige competenties en past ook je manier van aanpakken en samenwerken in ons team? Dan start je in graad 8.
Beloftevolle kandidaten die nog niet meteen alle opdrachten kunnen opnemen of nog een specifiek opleidingstraject moeten doorlopen, starten in graad 7.
Graad 9 is uitzonderlijk weggelegd voor kandidaten die al van bij de start, omwille van doorgedreven kennis en ervaring, extra verantwoordelijkheden kunnen opnemen.


Werken bij ICTS

Interesse?

Meer informatie is te verkrijgen bij Kath Leenknecht, tel.: +32 16 37 63 24.

Solliciteren voor deze vacature kan tot en met 14/01/2025 via onze online sollicitatietoepassing

KU Leuven wil een inclusieve, respectvolle en sociaal veilige gemeenschap zijn. Wij omarmen diversiteit tussen individuen en groepen als een meerwaarde. Open dialoog en verschillen in perspectief zijn noodzakelijk in een ambitieuze onderzoeks- en onderwijsomgeving. In ons streven naar gelijke kansen erkennen wij de gevolgen van historische ongelijkheden. Wij aanvaarden geen enkele vorm van discriminatie op basis van, onder meer, geslacht, genderidentiteit en -expressie, seksuele oriëntatie, leeftijd, etnische of nationale afkomst, huidskleur, levensbeschouwelijke overtuiging, neurodivergentie, arbeidshandicap, gezondheid, of socio-economische status. Bij vragen over toegankelijkheid of aangeboden ondersteuning helpen we je graag op dit e-mailadres .


Sollicitatieprocedure
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Loopbaanmogelijkheden


Heb je een vraag over de online sollicitatieprocedure? Raadpleeg onze veelgestelde vragen of stuur een e-mail naar solliciteren@kuleuven.be

Solliciteer voor deze functie
Show more

  • Je beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden om gegevens te interpreteren, trends te identificeren en beslissingen te nemen op basis van data.
  • Je bent in staat om complexe problemen te identificeren, IT-architecturen te ontwerpen en oplossingsvoorstellen uit te werken.
  • Je bent een creatief denker en ontwikkelt innovatieve ideeën.
  • Je kan kosten en baten afwegen en zorgt zo voor een duurzame en ethische inzet van AI.
  • Onze voertaal is Nederlands. Basiskennis van het Engels is daarnaast een must.

Aanbod

Een job met impact en complexe uitdagingen. Waar je kennis blijft verdiepen, verbreden of allebei. Waar je een goede balans tussen werk en privé kan combineren met een waaier aan groeimogelijkheden. En waar je gewoon kan zijn wie je bent.

Daarbij Hoort Natuurlijk Ook Nog Dit

  • Een mooi verloond voltijds contract van onbepaalde duur. Tewerkstelling van 80% is bespreekbaar.
  • Extra’s als hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, ecocheques, fietsvergoeding, thuiswerkvergoeding, …
  • Collega’s en techies om mee te sparren en van te leren binnen een uitdagende maar warme omgeving.
  • Een topsfeer die we met plezier voeden tijdens heel wat fun-momenten tijdens en buiten het werk.

ICTS is het Silicon Valley van KU Leuven, zonder de tech-reuzen. ICTS is een echte technologie-hub waar 300 gepassioneerden voor kwaliteit, verwondering en innovatie zorgen. Dit alles in een agile speeltuin waar we de lat zo hoog mogelijk maar de drempels laag houden. Ontdek meer over werken bij ICTS: https://www.kuleuven.be/icts/jobs (klik op de link bij 'Meer informatie').

Tot Slot, Onze Barema’s

  • Ben je onmiddellijk inzetbaar in alle opdrachten van deze job, heb je de nodige competenties en past ook je manier van aanpakken en samenwerken in ons team? Dan start je in graad 8.
  • Beloftevolle kandidaten die nog niet meteen alle opdrachten kunnen opnemen of nog een specifiek opleidingstraject moeten doorlopen, starten in graad 7.
  • Graad 9 is uitzonderlijk weggelegd voor kandidaten die al van bij de start, omwille van doorgedreven kennis en ervaring, extra verantwoordelijkheden kunnen opnemen.

Werken bij ICTS

Interesse?

Meer informatie is te verkrijgen bij Kath Leenknecht, tel.: +32 16 37 63 24.

Solliciteren voor deze vacature kan tot en met 14/01/2025 via onze online sollicitatietoepassing

KU Leuven wil een inclusieve, respectvolle en sociaal veilige gemeenschap zijn. Wij omarmen diversiteit tussen individuen en groepen als een meerwaarde. Open dialoog en verschillen in perspectief zijn noodzakelijk in een ambitieuze onderzoeks- en onderwijsomgeving. In ons streven naar gelijke kansen erkennen wij de gevolgen van historische ongelijkheden. Wij aanvaarden geen enkele vorm van discriminatie op basis van, onder meer, geslacht, genderidentiteit en -expressie, seksuele oriëntatie, leeftijd, etnische of nationale afkomst, huidskleur, levensbeschouwelijke overtuiging, neurodivergentie, arbeidshandicap, gezondheid, of socio-economische status. Bij vragen over toegankelijkheid of aangeboden ondersteuning helpen we je graag op dit e-mailadres .

  • Sollicitatieprocedure
  • Arbeidsvoorwaarden
  • Loopbaanmogelijkheden

Heb je een vraag over de online sollicitatieprocedure? Raadpleeg onze veelgestelde vragen of stuur een e-mail naar solliciteren@kuleuven.be

Solliciteer voor deze functie

Title: Senior Machine Learning/AI Engineer in Life Sciences
Description:
Arevna is hiring on behalf of a client seeking a highly skilled Senior Machine Learning/AI Engineer to contribute to transformative advancements in the life sciences industry. This is an exciting opportunity to leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning to solve complex challenges in healthcare and biotechnology.




As a Senior Machine Learning/AI Engineer, you will lead the design, development, and deployment of innovative AI-driven solutions. Collaborating with experts across bioinformatics, computational biology, and data science, you will play a critical role in advancing technologies that improve patient outcomes, accelerate drug discovery, and enable groundbreaking research.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize advanced machine learning models for applications such as genomics, proteomics, and biomedical imaging.
Design and implement scalable, cloud-based pipelines for data processing and model deployment.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to address domain-specific challenges and deliver impactful solutions.
Stay current with advancements in AI/ML research and integrate emerging techniques to enhance our products and services.
Contribute to publications and open-source projects to further innovation in the life sciences field.




Required Qualifications

Advanced degree (Master’s or Ph.D.) in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Bioinformatics, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in developing and deploying machine learning models, preferably in life sciences or healthcare.
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
Expertise in managing large-scale biological datasets, such as next-generation sequencing or imaging data.




Preferred Skills

Familiarity with deep learning architectures for biomedical imaging or natural language processing.
Experience with multi-omics data integration or systems biology approaches.
Knowledge of regulatory standards for healthcare AI, including HIPAA and GDPR compliance.




Why Join Us

Work on projects that drive meaningful impact in healthcare and scientific discovery.
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of experts committed to excellence and innovation.
Competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional development.




Arevna is proud to support this search and connect exceptional talent with this unique opportunity. If you are passionate about using AI/ML to transform life sciences and are ready to tackle complex challenges in a dynamic environment, we invite you to apply.

Title: Python Software Engineer
Description:
Permanent position only

WHAT CREAM IS ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship




And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues




WHAT IS A PYTHON SOFTWARE ENGINEER AT CREAM?

As a Python Software Engineer, embrace your role and work with multidisciplinary teams on challenging projects as:

Reporting tools (finance…)
Web applications
Power calculation
Cloud migrations…




YOUR TASKS :

You define technical specifications
You develop and test new innovative tools
You maintain and support Python libraries with other developers
You coach users through ad-hoc training sessions and code reviews
You provide technological watch to keep up to date on state-of-the-art technologies




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You love designing, developing, testing and maintaining applications
You hold a Master’s Degree (civil engineer, software engineering…)
You are used to work with Python (Pandas, Numpy…) and C#
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset

Bonus :

You have knowledge of technologies among Angular, Kubernetes, Dockers, Azure, Git…
You have IT Infrastructure knowledge

WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE THE LIME FLAVOUR?




A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!

Title: Data Engineer/Scientist
Description:
Requisition ID: 2997

Location:

Louvain-la-Neuve, BE

Work regime: Full-Time

Kind of contract: Open Ended Contract

Mission

As a data engineer/scientist in the IBA Clinical Digital team, you will work with data analysts, scientists and engineers to support our Proton Therapy business unit. The mission of the team is to power the digitalisation of our Proton Therapy business, spanning installations & operations of the PT centres, finance, product management, ...

Over the past years, the team has been working 1/ on creating a data-driven company with ready-to-use dashboards, datasets and self-services in the datawarehouses; 2/ improving our operations with advanced analytics (e.g. predictive maintenance, machine alarms), 3/ digitizing employee experience & internal processes via PowerApps. This could not be possible without a strong data backbone.

Challenges we trust you with


As a Data Engineer/Scientist, you build robust and scalable data pipelines that enable various analyses from Data scientist or Data Analyst. The data can vary in size, going until hundreds of Terabytes when it comes to machine data.
You are able to optimize the performance of your data processing using concepts like distributed computing, CPU/memory/IO balancing etc.
You advise the team in charge of machine data collection on best practices in term of storage and format
You collaborate with the data architect to implement the global data strategy
You participate in machine learning projects such as predictive maintenance, both on the data science side and the MLOps side.
You explore data to provide insights about its quality and content
You ensure the adoption of new datasets by supporting/upskilling data analysts
You coach junior team members on technical topics


What We Value


Master degree in Computer Science, Data Science or Engineering or equivalent experience
At least 4 years’ proven experience in data engineering or data science
Proficient in Pyton, Git, SQL
Relevant cloud experience (Azure preferred)
Experience with Apache Spark or any other distributed computing framework
Having handled big data in the past
Passionate about data


Nice to have


Experience with Terraform
Experience with Databricks, Delta tables
Experience with Azure Data Factory, Dagster
Experience with Knowledge in engineering (physics, electromagnetism, mechanics)
Experience in machine learning
Knowledge of the JVM internals


And You Also Are


Internal customer-oriented
Able to explain highly technical concepts to less technical people in an understandable way
Autonomous and eager to learn new technologies
Proactive and willing to share ideas to help the team grow
Fluent in English, French is a plus


Cherry on the cake

IBA Offers


Competitive salary and benefits, including a company car
Flexible home office policy (3days/week)
Career growth within a globally recognized leader in medical technology
A supportive team environment that values each member's development
A commitment to cutting-edge technology and solving challenging problems
Be part of a BCorp Certified company, balancing professional innovation with personal well-being


Join us at IBA, where you can be part of a dynamic team working on cutting-edge technology in the fight against cancer. Let's make a difference together!

Title: Team Lead Data Scientist
Description:
Ищем Team Lead Data Scientist с 5+ годами опыта на удаленную работу в потрясающую компанию с сильной командой ;-)




Мы делаем фандрайзинговую платформу Fundraise Up. Это самый удобный и быстрый способ пожертвовать деньги в пользу некоммерческого фонда. Мы изобретаем способы ускорить загрузку, увеличить конверсию, принять оплату разными способами и т.д. Каждый месяц люди со всего мира донатят десятки миллионов долларов через нашу платформу.

Крупнейшие некоммерческие организации мира используют наше решение чтобы собирать деньги. Например, UNICEF, самый известный международный фонд ООН, делает весь онлайн-фандрайзинг на нашей платформе. Аналогично поступают Барак Обама, Ассоциация изучения Альцгеймера и многие другие. Наш рейтинг на самой популярной платформе для отзывов — 4.9 из 5.

Мы работаем в энтерпрайз-сегменте. Наши клиенты находятся по всему миру, но основная концентрация приходится на США, Канаду, Великобританию и Австралию.




Продукт




Продукт, который мы делаем — большой и сложный. Он состоит из нескольких частей: чекаут и виджеты (каждый из них, это небольшое SPA), порталы для донора, организации и партнеров, админка и еще несколько приложений.




Команда




В компании работает 200 человек. В офисе в Нью-Йорке маркетинг, продажи, онбординг и саппорт. Удаленно мы принимаем продуктовые решения, делаем дизайн и разработку.

Продуктовая команда маленькая и в этом кайф — у нас нет «незначительных» задач. Все что мы делаем — важно. Команда сильная и в этом отдельный кайф — всегда интересно быть в окружении крутых людей, которые делятся опытом.




Ожидания от кандидата




Мы ищем тимлида, который залидит команду из 2 DS-ов и возьмет на себя ключевую роль в развитии и улучшении текущих процессов в ML команде. Вам предстоит анализировать существующие решения, выявлять возможности для оптимизации и внедрять новые подходы и технологии. Ваша роль будет включать активное взаимодействие с различными стейкхолдерами (в первую очередь, с техническими командами), внедрение практик и написание документации по проектам и процессам.




Кого ищем




Опыт работы в области дата саенс, разработки или инженерии от 5 лет.
Опыт в построении команд, и работы с ней (проведении 1:1 встреч, предоставлении конструктивных фидбеков, разрешении конфликтов) и постановка задач команде.
Уверенные знания в области анализа данных, статистики, машинного обучения и работы с большими данными (ключевые термины - “RecSys”, “Uplift modeling”, “Churn prediction”, “LTV prediction”, “Forecasting”).
Опыт работы с MLOps практиками (Experiment Tracking, Model Registry, Feature Store, auto-retraining, Online serving, Models monitoring).
Опыт построения и оптимизации рабочих процессов, включая процессы CI/CD, автоматизации тестирования, развертывания моделей.
Опыт взаимодействия с мультифункциональными командами и понимание потребностей бизнеса.




Супер-важно уметь соблюдать все виды договоренностей.




Пара важных вещей




Позиция предполагает релокацию. При желании вы можете воспользоваться нашей программой релокации, которая распространяется на Европу, Сербию и Грузию.
Мы работаем удаленно, но с 9 до 18 часов по CET. В это время мы интенсивно созваниваемся и много обсуждаем.
Итоговая сумма компенсации будет зависеть от вашего опыта, результатов тестового задания и технического интервью, а так же вашей страны проживания.




Зачем мы вам




Мы строим сильную команду людей с горящими глазами. У каждого свой опыт, которым он охотно делится.
У нас нет ветвистой иерархии, все люди доступны на расстоянии zoom-звонка. В компании открыта почти вся финансовая статистика, мы регулярно рассказываем как устроен продукт, продажи, саппорт, откуда появляются клиенты и деньги, что интересного случилось и т.д.
Мы верим в долгие отношения и выдаем разработчикам сток-опции. Компания хорошо растет — только за прошлый год мы вырастили метрики в два раза.




Бонусы




Нам важно чтобы работая удаленно, вы чувствовали себя комфортно. Обычно мы отправляем сотрудникам Macbook и нужное число мониторов. Если ваше рабочее место не обустроено, то пришлем стол, удобное кресло и все что нужно для продуктивной работы.

Полностью оплачиваем необходимое ПО, книги и коворкинг, если не хотите работать из дома. Помогаем с оплатой спортзала и бассейна, курсов английского и любого профильного образования.

Раз в год собираемся всей командой в оффлайне. В 2021 мы арендовали огромную виллу на Кипре, в 2022 встречались в отеле под Тбилиси, а в 2023 устроили недельный выезд на 60 человек на курорт в Турции. В следующем году будет что-то новое :-)

Show more

Мы работаем в энтерпрайз-сегменте. Наши клиенты находятся по всему миру, но основная концентрация приходится на США, Канаду, Великобританию и Австралию.


Продукт


Продукт, который мы делаем — большой и сложный. Он состоит из нескольких частей: чекаут и виджеты (каждый из них, это небольшое SPA), порталы для донора, организации и партнеров, админка и еще несколько приложений.


Команда


В компании работает 200 человек. В офисе в Нью-Йорке маркетинг, продажи, онбординг и саппорт. Удаленно мы принимаем продуктовые решения, делаем дизайн и разработку.

Продуктовая команда маленькая и в этом кайф — у нас нет «незначительных» задач. Все что мы делаем — важно. Команда сильная и в этом отдельный кайф — всегда интересно быть в окружении крутых людей, которые делятся опытом.


Ожидания от кандидата


Мы ищем тимлида, который залидит команду из 2 DS-ов и возьмет на себя ключевую роль в развитии и улучшении текущих процессов в ML команде. Вам предстоит анализировать существующие решения, выявлять возможности для оптимизации и внедрять новые подходы и технологии. Ваша роль будет включать активное взаимодействие с различными стейкхолдерами (в первую очередь, с техническими командами), внедрение практик и написание документации по проектам и процессам.


Кого ищем


  • Опыт работы в области дата саенс, разработки или инженерии от 5 лет.
  • Опыт в построении команд, и работы с ней (проведении 1:1 встреч, предоставлении конструктивных фидбеков, разрешении конфликтов) и постановка задач команде.
  • Уверенные знания в области анализа данных, статистики, машинного обучения и работы с большими данными (ключевые термины - “RecSys”, “Uplift modeling”, “Churn prediction”, “LTV prediction”, “Forecasting”).
  • Опыт работы с MLOps практиками (Experiment Tracking, Model Registry, Feature Store, auto-retraining, Online serving, Models monitoring).
  • Опыт построения и оптимизации рабочих процессов, включая процессы CI/CD, автоматизации тестирования, развертывания моделей.
  • Опыт взаимодействия с мультифункциональными командами и понимание потребностей бизнеса.


Супер-важно уметь соблюдать все виды договоренностей.


Пара важных вещей


  • Позиция предполагает релокацию. При желании вы можете воспользоваться нашей программой релокации, которая распространяется на Европу, Сербию и Грузию.
  • Мы работаем удаленно, но с 9 до 18 часов по CET. В это время мы интенсивно созваниваемся и много обсуждаем.
  • Итоговая сумма компенсации будет зависеть от вашего опыта, результатов тестового задания и технического интервью, а так же вашей страны проживания.


Зачем мы вам


  • Мы строим сильную команду людей с горящими глазами. У каждого свой опыт, которым он охотно делится.
  • У нас нет ветвистой иерархии, все люди доступны на расстоянии zoom-звонка. В компании открыта почти вся финансовая статистика, мы регулярно рассказываем как устроен продукт, продажи, саппорт, откуда появляются клиенты и деньги, что интересного случилось и т.д.
  • Мы верим в долгие отношения и выдаем разработчикам сток-опции. Компания хорошо растет — только за прошлый год мы вырастили метрики в два раза.


Бонусы


Нам важно чтобы работая удаленно, вы чувствовали себя комфортно. Обычно мы отправляем сотрудникам Macbook и нужное число мониторов. Если ваше рабочее место не обустроено, то пришлем стол, удобное кресло и все что нужно для продуктивной работы.

Полностью оплачиваем необходимое ПО, книги и коворкинг, если не хотите работать из дома. Помогаем с оплатой спортзала и бассейна, курсов английского и любого профильного образования.

Раз в год собираемся всей командой в оффлайне. В 2021 мы арендовали огромную виллу на Кипре, в 2022 встречались в отеле под Тбилиси, а в 2023 устроили недельный выезд на 60 человек на курорт в Турции. В следующем году будет что-то новое :-)

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:
Our client is looking for an experienced Lead Data Scientist




Responsibilities:

Development and training of transformer-based models for both text and images.
Architect and oversee the entire model lifecycle, from data preparation, model design, training, development and validation to model deployment and monitoring.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts, to design and implement AI-driven solutions.
Stay current with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, integrating new techniques and technologies as appropriate.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Strong expertise with large scale Neural Networks, Deep Learning and Reinforcement Learning techniques.
Practical exposure to GenAI projects and related frameworks (RAG apps, vector DBs, LangChain, LlamaIndex, agentic frameworks, ...)
Advanced knowledge of Python and machine learning frameworks (SciPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, pyMC, pgmpy, ...)
Hands-on experience with one or more cloud computing platforms (Azure - preferred, AWS, GCP).
Understanding of the whole ML lifecycle and experience with MLOps/DataOps.
Experience with Probabilistic Graphical Modelling (Bayesian Networks, Markov Random Fields, Factor Graphs, ...)
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Good communication skills, fluent English.




Start date: ASAP

Contract Duration: 6 months with likelihood of extension

Remote vs Onsite: Fully remote, with possible occasional in person team sessions / workshops / gatherings (i.e. 1x quarter) likely to take place in Prague

US Hours overlap needed?: Minimum 2-6pm CET, preferred 2-7pm CET

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🤖 The Job

At Dataroots, we couple our excellent consulting services with our technical expertise to build cutting-edge machine learning models to improve business processes across a variety of industries, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our in-house team of AI specialists, designing and implementing models that deliver robust, data-driven solutions for our clients.

You’re passionate about data, and you enjoy diving deep into it to unlock actionable insights. Your expertise lies in developing and fine-tuning machine learning models that directly improve client operations. You’ll experiment with different approaches to ensure top-tier results, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers and Cloud Architects to deliver tailored solutions, always with a quality-focused, end-to-end perspective.

You’ll also have the opportunity to mentor colleagues, share knowledge, and stay on top of industry developments through a range of initiatives we support internally.




🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💼 What we’re looking for

A deep passion for Machine Learning and a Master’s or PhD in a quantitative discipline.
Strong foundation in software design principles.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in a field related to machine learning and big data.
Expertise in machine learning and deep learning, with both a theoretical and practical grasp.
Proficiency in Python is a must; experience with SQL is a big plus, and knowledge of R or Scala is an advantage.
Experience deploying machine learning models and familiarity with MLOps practices.
Basic understanding of cloud engineering.
Enthusiasm for working with large datasets and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complex technical concepts for clients.
Fluency in both English and Dutch.




Don't worry if you don’t meet every requirement from the start. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! 🎉

Show more

Title: Big Data Developer (NL + ENG)
Description:
Founded in 2020 in Belgium, ATS4IT is part of the Moongy Group, established to strengthen agap2IT’s presence in Europe.

Since 2021 we expanded further with the opening of our Danish branch in Copenhagen, and our Spanish brand in Madrid, reinforcing our commitment to being a key player in the European technology landscape.

Proximity, transparency, and collaboration define our approach at ATS. We aim to be your trusted partner and the first choice for your technological challenges

Position: Big Data Developer

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Hybrid: 2-3 times a week on the client´s office

Candidates must possess European nationality or a valid work permit for Belgium

Mandatory Languages: One of the national languages (Dutch and French) must be the mother tongue, and the other language must be understood and readable

Job Description:

We are looking for a Big Data Developer to handle large-scale data processing and build efficient solutions for handling structured and unstructured data.

Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain big data solutions using tools like Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka;
Optimize data pipelines for high-speed processing and analysis;
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to enable advanced analytics;
Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies;
Troubleshoot and resolve performance issues in big data environments.



Requirements:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or related field.
4-6 years of experience in Big Data
Strong knowledge of distributed computing and big data frameworks;
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Scala;
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS EMR, Azure HDInsight, GCP BigQuery);
Familiarity with database systems (HBase, Cassandra, MongoDB);



What We Offer


DKV Insurance
Free training (technical, behavioral, language) and certifications
Continuous and personalized career progression support
Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies
Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.



At ATS4IT, part of the agap2IT family, we promote equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, based solely on merit.

Join us and be part of the future!

Title: Project Engineer - Automation/Mechatronic/Data Science
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Are you ready to unleash your technical creativity?

Innovation is the driving force behind everything we do at P&G! Across the world, you will find thousands of scientists, engineers and developers working in manufacturing plants, innovation centers and distribution facilities.

As an Engineer, you will take part in designing new machines and their components, ensuring the accurate selection, specification and construction of mechanical equipment as well as owning the upgrades of our manufacturing lines worldwide. You will also be developing innovative automation systems, control information networks, vision and robotic systems which deliver outstanding and highly efficient production systems.

Engineers in this field leverage their passion for mechatronics and process dynamic simulation tools to build industrial solutions to enable efficient production!

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

You will typically start as a Technical Engineer in the areas of process control, automation, robotics, electrical design, industrial SW development, manufacturing digitization and/or plant network design with specific responsibilities on a key project that will involve the following:

  • Design and evaluate technical options for achieving business objectives;
  • Prepare a design basis for the project, based on engineering studies, high end computer modeling and simulation, economic evaluations and consultations with Manufacturing, Research & Development and other contributing groups;
  • Design, develop and procure new processing equipment in collaboration with suppliers;
  • Develop and conduct acceptance tests on equipment purchased from vendors;
  • Lead new equipment start-ups in the production plants and train the production teams;
  • Solve equipment problems working closely with production staff on new or existing operations.

Your first assignment gives you the chance to contribute with your engineering skills to the business from Day 1, while developing your leadership skills. You have clear responsibilities that stretch your technical abilities. You will work in professional and entrepreneurial cross-functional teams while receiving valuable mentoring as well as functional and corporate trainings.

Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:

  • University Master degree or equivalent in mechanical engineering/electro-mechanic/electrical/automation/robotics/mechatronics/controls engineering or similar with good academic results and work experience;
  • Proficient in English;
  • Technical curiosity, creativity, innovation, initiative, communication, leadership and the ability to work with others.

Your Advantages

  • A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
  • Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
  • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
  • Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
  • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
  • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
  • Subsidized company restaurant;
  • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
  • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
  • Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
  • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
  • Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.
  • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
  • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:

ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

  • Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
  • P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
  • We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000107723

Job Segmentation

Recent Grads/Entry Level (Job Segmentation)

Title: Solver - Generative AI Specialist
Description:
About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation, providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services tailored to empower its partners and address their unique challenges. We tackle complex challenges with a holistic approach, fostering collaboration across diverse expertise areas, including Data Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Governance.




Our "Solvers" are passionate professionals empowered by cutting-edge tools, a culture of knowledge sharing, and continuous learning opportunities. We are seeking a Generative AI Specialist to join our team of experts, helping our clients leverage the power of advanced AI technologies to transform their operations.




Your Role:

As a Generative AI Specialist, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and clients to design, develop, and deploy innovative AI solutions, with a particular focus on generative models and their applications.




What You’ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Collaboration: Engage with clients to identify business needs, explore AI opportunities, and deliver tailored solutions leveraging generative AI.
Use Case Development: Analyze client challenges to propose and implement generative AI applications such as text generation, image synthesis, content creation, or workflow automation.




Technical Implementation

Model Development: Design, build, and fine-tune generative AI models using frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, and Hugging Face.
Agent Design: Create agent-based architectures for real-time decision-making and task automation.
Integration: Connect generative AI systems with external tools, APIs, and enterprise systems to optimize workflow and performance.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on the latest advancements in generative AI and contribute to internal R&D initiatives.
Experiment with emerging models, techniques, and tools to ensure cutting-edge solutions for clients.




Project Management

Plan, execute, and oversee the delivery of AI projects, ensuring timely and high-quality outcomes.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure smooth project integration.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions for clients to empower their teams with generative AI capabilities.
Provide ongoing support for deployed solutions to ensure scalability and optimization.




What We’re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications

Educational Background: Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or related fields.
Technical Expertise: Proven experience with generative AI frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, Hugging Face, or similar.
Programming Proficiency: Advanced skills in Python and familiarity with AI libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for deploying AI models.
Communication Skills: Strong ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Preferred Skills

Experience in fine-tuning and customizing large language models (LLMs).
Familiarity with agent-based systems for task automation.
Knowledge of MLOps tools and best practices for AI model deployment and monitoring.
Strong business acumen to align AI solutions with strategic goals.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse and innovative AI projects across industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Benefit from the latest GenAI tools as well as an annual budget for certifications, training, and conferences to stay ahead in your field.
Collaborative Environment: Join a team that values collective intelligence and a supportive culture.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model that offers remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Package: Attractive salary, performance bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.

Show more

  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure smooth project integration.


Training and Support

  • Conduct workshops and training sessions for clients to empower their teams with generative AI capabilities.
  • Provide ongoing support for deployed solutions to ensure scalability and optimization.


What We’re Looking For:


Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Educational Background: Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or related fields.
  • Technical Expertise: Proven experience with generative AI frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, Hugging Face, or similar.
  • Programming Proficiency: Advanced skills in Python and familiarity with AI libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for deploying AI models.
  • Communication Skills: Strong ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Skills

  • Experience in fine-tuning and customizing large language models (LLMs).
  • Familiarity with agent-based systems for task automation.
  • Knowledge of MLOps tools and best practices for AI model deployment and monitoring.
  • Strong business acumen to align AI solutions with strategic goals.


Why Join Us?

  • Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse and innovative AI projects across industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing.
  • Continuous Learning: Benefit from the latest GenAI tools as well as an annual budget for certifications, training, and conferences to stay ahead in your field.
  • Collaborative Environment: Join a team that values collective intelligence and a supportive culture.
  • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model that offers remote and in-office collaboration.
  • Competitive Package: Attractive salary, performance bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.

Title: Senior Research Officer
Description:
The Hydrogen Council is recruiting for an experienced Senior Research Officer to join our growing Research team.

Are you interested in being at the forefront of the clean energy revolution and helping drive the global transition towards a sustainable, hydrogen-powered future?




The Hydrogen Council, the global CEO-led initiative comprising the world’s leading companies and investors in hydrogen, is recruiting for a highly motivated Senior Research Officer to contribute to its mission.




As the Senior Research Officer, you will work report to the Head of Research and work closely with the Research team of the Hydrogen Council as well as support the organisation’s global team based out of Canada, UK, Belgium and Germany.




Key responsibilities

Identify, gather, structure and interpret relevant data sources.
Create databases, develop economic models and undertook analysis using data from Hydrogen Council members and external sources.
Partner with Hydrogen Council members and external stakeholders across the industry to deliver analytical support. This will involve various analysis techniques (e.g., statistical, forecasting, cost-benefit).
Transform data and results into easy-to-use formats for Hydrogen Council members and stakeholders.
Develop report/outlooks and effectively communicate analysis and recommendations to stakeholders, shaping the narrative around key findings.
Provide analytical support to the Policy, Communications and Marketplace team of the Hydrogen Council and collaborate with other relevant work streams as needed.




Our offer

Unique opportunities to learn and grow in a dynamic international work environment, including hands-on training with some of the best in the industry
Direct collaboration with business and issue experts from across the world’s leading energy, transport and industry companies
A highly collaborative, mission-oriented team culture and a flexible hybrid work set-up
Opportunities to travel




Qualifications and skills

Experience: at least 8-10 years of experience in similar roles.
Education: University degree with engineering background.
Languages: Excellent communication skills in English and at least one other language.
Technical proficiency: Strong analytical skills with the ability to understand complex issues. Experience with energy-related data structures, such as time series aggregation Experience in energy system and modelling (hourly system model, eg: Plexos Energy Modelling Software), scenario analysis.
Issue knowledge: Excellent knowledge of the energy sector (power & gas). Understanding of the role of hydrogen in the future energy mix and Power-to-X technologies.
Team player: Collaborative, adaptable, and able to work effectively with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and members to achieve shared objectives.
Advanced communications and presentation design skills: Proven ability to distil actionable insights from complex data sets and to express ideas clearly and succinctly. Experience in data visualisation a strong plus.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail: Ability to work independently and in a structured way, with great attention to detail. Solution- and process-oriented approach, with the ability to adapt to changing circumstances.
Professional conduct: Diplomacy, discretion, tact and ability to represent the Council and its leadership towards members as well as external stakeholders.
Adaptability: Comfortable working in a fast-paced, multicultural, and hybrid work environment. Demonstrated ability to manage time effectively across different time zones and adapt to varying work requirements.
Service mindset: Strong fit for a membership-based organization with a demonstrated ability to thrive in an member-driven trade group environment.
Flexibility: Given the Council’s global nature with member companies across the Americas, EMEA, and APAC, reasonable flexibility is required for accommodating meeting times and fostering collaborative relationships.




Travel: Willingness to travel occasionally, depending on the candidate’s location




Other information

Contract type: full-time employee
Expected start date: as soon as available. Please indicate potential earliest start date and notice length (if applicable).
Remuneration: competitive, based on experience
Location: hybrid position, with a preference for candidates in or close to Central European (CET) time zone and with the ability to travel to Brussels and work with the Hydrogen Council team in person on agreed occasions.




Application process

Closing date: 17 January 2025. Interviews will start shortly thereafter.
How to apply: Please send your CV (max. 2 pages) and a short letter (max. 1 page) outlining your motivation and why you are the right person for the role to vacancy@hydrogencouncil.com using ‘Vacancy / Senior Research Officer as the email subject line.
Please note: Only applications sent through that channel and containing both the CV as well as the letter will be considered. Due to anticipated volume of applications, please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted with further information.




About the Hydrogen Council

When the Hydrogen Council launched at the World Economic Forum in Davos in January 2017, it was the first initiative of its kind in the world – and still is. The Council is a global, CEO-led coalition that brings together a diverse group of some 140 business and investor leaders from around the world, across the entire hydrogen value chain, including large multinationals, innovative start-ups, and investors. Our members have a united vision and ambition for hydrogen to accelerate the clean energy transition.




Operating globally, the Council is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium. www.hydrogencouncil.com

Title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test I, AI governance
Description:
Joining Collibra’s Test Engineering team


You will take part in testing activities in the Scrum Team and assist in the successful execution of testing strategies.
You will develop and promote the testing knowledge within an Agile team and provide the needed help and assistance in enabling developers to test.
You will share your experience on a variety of testing tools relevant to our business environment and drive experimentation towards further improvements.
You will define and maintain metrics and promote testing awareness within Engineering.
You will promote a shift-left approach in testing across Engineering.
You will drive Test Data definition and develop scalable frameworks and tools to solve problems.


This is a hybrid position based in Brussels, Belgium.

SDET, Test Engineering at Collibra are responsible for


Reviewing requirement specifications and user stories to provide timely and meaningful feedback.
Designing, development and execution of automation scripts and Test Automation frameworks (Cypress, Playwright, Rest Assured, etc).
Working on the continuous integration of your scripts (Jenkins) and driving the team on the way towards continuous testing.
Identifying, documenting and tracking issues.
Working closely with Software/Test Engineers and Product Managers across the organization to understand the context and drive automation and testing to meet objectives.
Taking part in exploratory testing and test design sessions - to help in improving the overall product quality.
Acquiring a deep understanding of the domain and approach testing holistically, ensuring comprehensive coverage.
Have a critical mindset to discern what to automate and what not to, strategically sampling critical tests with a focus on balancing risk, cost, and value.
Coach developers and other SDETs.
K8s and Helm chart.


You Have


Minimum 8 years of experience in Test Automation.
Knowledge of software QA methodologies and tools (JIRA or similar) and processes.
Experience in Java and/or TypeScript and hands-on experience with automated testing tools (Cypress, Playwright, Rest Assured, etc.).
Experience with DevOps, Gradle, Jenkins and Docker.
Good communication skills and enjoy collaborating with fellow co-workers.
Ability to identify flaws in the testing process, toolset, infrastructure and to propose and drive necessary improvements.
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent related working experience is required.
You must have work authorization to work in Brussels, Belgium.


You Are


Experienced in building Test Automation Frameworks and in continuous delivery/continuous testing environment.
Experienced in building/maintaining CICD pipelines.
Experienced in working in an Agile/Scrum development process.
Able to identify testing and quality challenges.
Able to create innovative solutions to solve complex problems.
A person with great communication skills and who enjoys collaborating with fellow co-worker.
Able to combine automation skills with manual part of testing (Exploratory).
Able to think independently with curiosity, criticism and keen attention to details.
Well organized and accustomed to an innovative environment.


Measures of success are


Within your first month, you will complete your onboarding and all the mandatory learnings, whilst becoming familiar with the product, tech stack and test frameworks.
Within your third month, you will be actively contributing to the test processes and improvements to test coverage.
Within your sixth month, you will own test projects and be driving the team on quality improvements.


Benefits at Collibra

Collibra recognizes and values that everyone has different needs, interests, and life goals. We built our {Be}well benefits program with flexibility in mind to support you and your loved ones through a diverse range of circumstances and life events. These flexible offerings sit on a foundation of competitive compensation, health coverage, and time off.

Professional Development

Collibrians are ambitious and inventive, and we want to develop our skills individually and as a team. You’ll have access to development opportunities, as well as other rewards and recognition programs to help grow your career.

Health Coverage

We strive to remain locally competitive and globally equitable. This means comprehensive offerings including medical, dental, vision, and mental health benefits for you and your family.

Paid Time Off and Flexibility

We offer global leave policies for a variety of personal and family circumstances, company-wide wellness days off throughout the year, meeting-free Wednesdays, and a flexible culture to help balance your work and your life.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

We create inclusion and belonging through how we onboard, meet, connect, engage, and communicate. Learn more about diversity, equity, and inclusion at Collibra.

Learn More About Collibra’s Benefits.

At Collibra, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer – which ties directly to our core value, “open, direct, and kind.” We realize the key to creating a company with a world-class culture and employee experience comes from who we hire and creating a workplace that celebrates everyone. If you have a need that requires accommodation, let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Title: Front-end Developer for EU Institutions
Description:
Arηs Group – part of Accenture - is a market leader in the management of complex IT projects and systems. Founded in Luxembourg in 2003, we have grown to encompass 12 entities worldwide, employing over 2,500 employees in Luxembourg, Belgium, Greece, Italy, Portugal and Bulgaria. With our focus on getting things done, we help our clients achieve their goals with best-of-breed solutions, superior execution and exceptional services. We offer bespoke software development, data science, infrastructure, digital trust and mobile development to government institutions at national and European level, telecom providers, and financial institutions, among others. Our bold company culture is built around working hard and playing hard, with a flat and agile structure that lends itself to efficiency and employee empowerment. We value our diverse workplace of close-knit teams and provide a place where everyone can be supported to learn and evolve.




Job Description

ARHS Group – part of Accenture – is looking for a Front-end Developer for one of its clients at the EU Institutions in Brussels




Role & responsibilities

Reading and understanding executable BPMN2.0 specifications
Reading and understanding BPMN and UML models
Reading and understanding functional and technical requirements
Implementing existing functional requirements for front-end using project selected technologies
Applying implementation best practices
Designing and developing APIs.
Participating in the design and creation of scalable software.
Taking lead on projects, as needed.
Maintenance of code integrity and organization.
Integration of DevOps pipelines
Design of user interactions on web pages.
Development of features to enhance the user experience.
Designing responsive applications.
Compiling and analyzing data, processes, and codes to troubleshoot problems and identifying areas for improvement.
Preparing and implementing Test scenarios and cases
Testing and fixing bugs or other coding issues.
Understanding and implementation of security and data protection.
Meeting both technical and consumer needs.
Writing technical documentation.




Qualifications

Your profile

University degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Autonomous.
Strong organizational and time-management skills.
Excellent verbal communication.
Attention to details.
Good problem-solving skills.
Capability of integration in an international/multicultural on multiple large projects.
Excellent Team Player
Ability to understand, speak and write in English
High degree of discretion and integrity is required as the applications managed and maintained contain personal and confidential data




Technical skills

Experience with Angular 14+, Javascript and front-end architecture and development

Very good expertise in micro-frontend architecture patterns
Knowledge and understanding of cloud architecture pattern and integration tools (AWS/Microsoft Azure)
Very good expertise in Angular 14+ framework and Typescript.
Expertise in JavaScript​: knowledge of the specificities of ES6 and TypeScript.
Proven experience in Client-side Single Page Application development.
Good expertise and effective work experience in CSS/SASS, HTML5, and SVG.
Effective work experience in big UI projects: multi-modules, multiple target devices. Maintenance of a large codeset.
Effective work experience in NodeJS development and dependency management.
Knowledge of Redux architecture with NgRx and state management is a plus.
Knowledge in PWA development using Ionic/Angular is a plus.

Experience in Web application security

Effective work experience with authentication systems based on SSO and CAS: Session cookie management through REST API, session time-out state recovery.
Expertise in Web vulnerabilities, including Cross site scripting and Cross site request forgery.

Expertise in Continuous Integration and Deployment

Working experience with the following tools: GitLab, JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, Nexus, Crucible, Jenkins and Sonar.
Modern DevSecOps Experience with Docker and Kubernetes is a plus.

Any of the following would be considered an asset

Knowledge of middleware integration platforms, micro-services, macro-services and event-driven based architectures.
Development knowledge, in particular with Java Spring and Angular
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application architecture and design and cloud architecture integration
Compass Corporate knowledge: capabilities (business and technical), technical setup (availability of environments, etc.), existing processes already automated with Compass Corporate. Compass Corporate framework: tasks configuration, microservices configuration
Experience with the Commission’s Reusable Solutions Platform, in particular with Compass Corporate, API Gateway, eUI, EU Login, Secunda+, Dynamic Forms and Kafka • Experience with ARIS (EA/BPM tool))

Title: AI Engineer-Public sector
Description:
Position Description

At CGI, we’re looking for AI experts who want to make a tangible impact. You’ll lead AI innovation, helping our clients unlock the true value of their data, while working with cutting-edge technologies in a team that values diversity and continuous learning.

Your role in our team


Lead AI Awareness: Conduct workshops to increase awareness of AI and demonstrate its value for our clients’ businesses.
Deliver AI Solutions: Use industry-specific methods to solve client challenges, create trusted data sets, and develop data pipelines for AI model training.
Accelerate Decision-Making: Guide clients toward “speed to trusted action” through AI solutions, discovering AI opportunities via AI Design Sprint workshops, and building AI centers of excellence with a focus on governance and ethical AI.
Develop & Optimize: Implement AI models and solutions, ensuring ethical and responsible practices, and optimize existing AI systems for better performance.
Full AI Lifecycle: Be involved in the full AI lifecycle, including data preparation, design, coding, testing, deployment, and support.
Best Practices & Knowledge Transfer: Create internal guidelines for AI, train internal teams, and contribute to best practices for ethical AI.
Stay Current: Keep up with the latest AI trends, technologies, and ethical standards, and address biases in AI datasets and models.
Document & Share: Maintain clear documentation of AI development processes and decisions, ensuring transparency


How You Strengthen Our Team

We need someone who can bring both expertise and a passion for AI:


Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models and AI solutions.
Expertise in at least 2 areas: Statistics, Regression, Clustering, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision, Time Series, Machine Learning Visualization, or Tree Ensembles.
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, or Java, and familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Strong data management skills, including data preprocessing and analysis.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.
Commitment to ethical AI practices and staying up-to-date with the field’s advancements.
Ability to handle multiple projects in a dynamic environment.
Clear communication and documentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluency in French or Dutch, with strong English skills.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a related field.
Medior Profile: 3 to 5 years of experience.
Senior Profile: More than 5 years of experience, preferably with a public sector background.


A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why join CGI?

At CGI, we believe in responsible and human-centric AI. For over 30 years, we’ve helped organizations realize lasting value from their AI investments. We prioritize outcomes that benefit stakeholders and align with societal values. Here’s what we offer:


A collaborative environment in small, self-managing expert teams.
The opportunity to drive your career with space for continuous development.
Work with the latest AI technologies.
An attractive salary with excellent benefits.
A permanent contract from the start.
The opportunity to become a CGI shareholder.


What's in it for you ?


Direct impact on the future of AI within a leading IT & Business consultancy.
Work with the latest technologies in a supportive and dynamic environment.
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning.
A focus on ethical AI and best practices in the field.
A diverse and inclusive workplace where your ideas are valued.


Join our team of experts and apply now!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Gregory Depasse, Director Consulting Services, Public sector, via gregory.depasse@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

XX

Job Description

xx

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Ensemble, en tant que propriétaires, mettons notre savoir-faire à l’œuvre.

La vie chez CGI est ancrée dans l’actionnariat, le travail d’équipe, le respect et un sentiment d’appartenance. Chez nous, vous pourrez exploiter votre plein potentiel parce que…

Nous vous invitons à devenir propriétaire dès le jour 1 alors que nous travaillons ensemble à faire de notre rêve une réalité. C’est pourquoi nous nous désignons comme associés de CGI, plutôt que comme employés. Nous tirons profit des retombées de notre succès collectif et contribuons activement à l’orientation et à la stratégie de notre entreprise.

Votre travail crée de la valeur. Vous élaborerez des solutions novatrices et développerez des relations durables avec vos collègues et clients, tout en ayant accès à des capacités mondiales pour concrétiser vos idées, saisir de nouvelles opportunités, et bénéficier d’une expertise sectorielle et technologique de pointe.

Vous ferez évoluer votre carrière en vous joignant à une entreprise bâtie pour croître et durer. Vous serez soutenus par des leaders qui ont votre santé et bien-être à cœur et qui vous permettront de saisir des occasions afin de parfaire vos compétences et élargir les horizons.

Joignez-vous à nous, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.

Title: Manufacturing & Supply Chain Data Scientist
Description:
Are you willing to make a step in your career and deliver AI solutions from early discovery stages up to industrialized solutions as part of large transformation projects? Are you willing to re-imagine the future of the industry, and the next generation of production process or supply chain control solutions? If this is the case, this role will be of interest to you!

Your job

You are part of a team of a multi-disciplinary team and contribute to delivery excellence across client engagements:



Interact with client and Accenture functional and industry consultants to identify the Data science requirements and solutions to solve industrial problems or challenges


Drive the extraction, wrangling and enrichment of data from one or multiple sources, online or offline.


Develop, train and validate advanced analytics models,


Visualize the data and model results through dynamic dashboards.


Design and architect, build, test, deploy, maintain state-of-the-art and production grade ML/AI solutions


Be able to articulate and defend analytics solutions in front of Business and Technical Stakeholders


Collaborate with our international multi-disciplinary teams (expert & international delivery center) to bring the best-in-class expertise and delivery capacity as part of large data transformation projects


Use cloud native services from major cloud providers as well as custom implementations


Stay up to date on newest trends, techniques, tools, and methodologies


Demonstrate a high degree of ownership, accountability for your output and commitment to the task.



You drive and participate to internal initiatives across Research & Development, skills development, presales

You are very curious, connect and maintain relationship with our network of innovation centers, international practices, ecosystem to bring the best of our experience and differentiators to our clients and our people.

Your team

Accenture Applied Intelligence covers the range of Data and AI skills, from Strategy, Data Science, Data Architecture, AI Engineering and Visual Insights. It is also our approach to scaling AI for our clients. We embed AI-powered data, analytics and automation capabilities into business workflows to accelerate time to value. Our expertise in defining end-to-end strategy, combined with deep data infrastructure capabilities, cognitive services and industrialized accelerators help smooth clients’ path to AI adoption, extending human capabilities and supporting clients in scaling AI responsibly. With 20K+ people around the globe, strong local practices and recognized as a leader by industry analysts, we collaborate with a powerful global alliance, innovation and delivery network to help clients deploy and scale AI within any market and industry.

Your background



Completed Master preferably in engineering or any other quantitative field with a strong focus on ML/AI, advanced analytics, data science, operations research.


A minimum of 2 years of experience in applying data & analytics techniques to manufacturing process & supply chain across one of the following industry: Life Science, Chemicals, Raw Materials Transformation, Goods manufacturing in environments related to operations


Proficient understanding of a few of the fundamental concepts related to plant data and information systems such as: automation systems, MES/DCS, machine sensorization, preventive or predictive maintenance strategies, line scheduling, OEE or equivalent metrics, quality processes, yield optimization, etc.


Excellent knowledge of at least one of the following programming language/frameworks: Python, R, Java, Matlab, SQL, Scala


Familiar with collaborative solutions, model & code versioning (Github), solution packaging (Docker)


Practical experience of cloud-based solutions is a strong plus.


Knowledge of Software Engineering standards and best practices is a strong plus


Knowledge of the AI/ML Model Lifecycle Management and tools including EDA, Modelling, Integration/Deployment, Data/Model drift detection, Model retraining, etc.


Up-to-date knowledge and skills in recent Machine Learning tools and techniques such as NN, NLP, Deep Learning, …


Passion for Innovation, collaboration with eco-system and create value for our clients


Aptitude to interact with functional or business stakeholders who are not familiar with ML Engineering considerations.


Fluent in English, in Dutch and/or in French



Our offer

Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture. We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.

We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.

Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:



13th month + holiday allowance


20 + 12 holidays


Laptop and smartphone


Hospitalization insurance and extensive group insurance package


Bonus program


Unique training & learning opportunities beyond your role specifics


Green mobility program: e-bikes, public transport, bike 2 work allowance,…


Flexrewards: decide on your rewards package with our flexible benefits tool


Discount program: get discounts at your favorite (online) shops


Employee shares purchase plan


Eco-cheques


And many more!

Title: Project Manager AI - Prompt Engineering / Data Science (Brussels-Based)
Description:
About SailPeak

At Sailpeak, we are a Brussels-based consulting firm specializing in guiding Banking & Insurance firms through the complexities of digital transformation.




With expertise in Business Strategy, Data & AI, and Digital Transformation, Sailpeak helps clients navigate the ever-evolving landscape and reach new heights of success.




🤖 About the Role

We are looking for a Prompt Engineer / Data Scientist with 3 years of experience, working on Gen AI tools to improve internal processes.




One of our leading banking clients is leveraging data science across many use cases to create value in crucial projects.




You will spearhead the transformation with tools like ChatGPT and Microsoft Office CoPilot to improve employee productivity and efficiency across processes. The use cases can come from Robotics, Compliance, Client Service Centers, Marketing, and Sales (the list keeps growing).




📊 You will:

Design and Create prompts using prompt engineering techniques
Understand business needs to identify cases where Gen AI can be leveraged to add value to our projects
Test and Evaluate the quality and accuracy of the output from your prompts
Train and Educate the rest of the business on the best practices around using GenAI & working on establishing a prompt academy (learning environment)
Document and Share your findings, results, and learnings with the rest of the business




📊 You bring to the table:

Experience working with Gen AI tools: ChatGPT, Mistral, Llama, and Microsoft Office CoPilot
Expertise in Advance Prompt Engineering from designing, creating, testing, and optimizing prompts
Independence and ability to plan your own work based on project requirements
Strategic thinking around aligning the current business needs and gaps in processes
Experience working with cross-functional teams (Engineering, Business, Product, etc.)
Stakeholder management (being able to communicate with various different stakeholders, managing roadblocks and frustrations, etc.)




🗣️ Language Skills

Fluency in English, French, and/or Dutch




🤹 Other Skills

Experience with Scrum or Agile methods is a great plus for us.
We are looking for proactive problem-solvers
You’ll be working independently & autonomously
Passion for growing, building, and continuous learning, especially around the developments within AI and Data Science
Working with cross-functional teams with different business needs, requirements, and challenges




🎁 What’s in it for you

💸 A competitive salary and benefits package.

🦾 Working on cutting-edge projects with leading banking clients, in a startup environment

💿 Exposure to a wide array of AI and data science technologies.

🫂 Mentorship from Directors and Partners with backgrounds from renowned companies like Google, PayPal, Semetis, and Sia Partners.




🧑‍🔬 The Process

Step 1: 30-minute call with our Head of Talent (Peter): focusing on your current situation, motivation, experience, and practicalities
Step 2: 30-minute call with one of our Founders (Stjepan or Nico): deep-dive into your experience
Step 3: Onsite Business Case with our team
Step 4: Offer!




Are you ready to embark on a rewarding career in management consulting with Sailpeak?

To apply for this role, kindly send your CV or reach out to careers@sailpeak.com




Set your course toward a transformative career at Sailpeak today!

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Senior Microsoft Dynamics CRM Developer




Key Responsibilities:




Conceptualize, develop, or adapt applications based on functional and business analysis to meet user requirements
Ensure thorough understanding of requirements and translate them into programming language and architecture
Collaborate with internal teams for functional analysis and design solutions
Conduct Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Agile testing
Document software and processes
Identify and report issues while proposing optimal solutions
Evaluate potential changes and their impact on software modules




Additional Tasks:




Quality assurance & test scenario creation
Retest and troubleshoot testing issues
Apply lessons learned and continuous improvements after each milestone
Provide leadership, coaching, and training to junior developers*




Technical Skills:




Expertise in Microsoft Dynamics Customer Engagement CRM
5+ years of Dynamics 365 Sales & Marketing experience
Extensive experience with .NET programming language
Knowledgeable in SSIS, KingswaySoft, SSRS
Agile methodology, JIRA, SVN
IBM-minded approach




Non-Technical Skills:




Strong customer service and communication skills
Excellent project planning, coordination, and tracking
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities
Ability to handle multiple tasks with minimal supervision
Leadership and mentoring skills for over 5 years

Qualifications:




Master’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Certified in Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement




Languages:




Fluent in English and French or Dutch
